title: Imam Bayildi (Stuffed Eggplants)
steps: Halve the eggplants lengthwise. Score flesh in a crosshatch pattern without breaking the skin.
Rub salt generously into flesh and set aside.
Heat olive oil in a large non-stick pan over high heat. Fry eggplant halves in batches until golden.
Place eggplants cut-side up in a baking dish.
Reduce heat to medium. Add onion to the pan with remaining oil and salt. Cook 5-6 minutes until soft and lightly colored.
Add garlic and cook 2 minutes until aromatic.
Add tomatoes and cook 5 minutes until breaking down.
Stir in cumin, paprika, oregano, tomato puree, and fresh herbs. Season with salt and pepper.
Remove from heat and stir in 4 tablespoons (60ml) water.
Spoon tomato mixture over eggplant halves. Drizzle remaining oil over dish.
Cover with foil and bake 1.5 hours until eggplants are very soft.
Serve warm or at room temperature.
notes: Volume conversions: 2 large eggplants ≈ 1000g, 150ml olive oil ≈ 150g, 1 onion ≈ 150g, 4 garlic cloves ≈ 20g, 4 large tomatoes ≈ 500g, 1 tsp spices ≈ 3g each, 1 tbsp tomato puree ≈ 15g, handful herbs ≈ 10g
Traditional Greek dish meaning 'the imam fainted'
